content.full_text: Pay Warrant for David Davis, 3 September 18531 $25000/100AUDITOR’S OFFICE,2ILLINOIS,No.8456 Treasurer of the State of Illinois, Pay toA. Lincolnor order, the sum ofTwo Hundred & Fifty—/—Dollars, it being forD Davissalary Judge8thcircuitQuarter Ending august 31, 1853 COUNTERSIGNED AND REGISTERED:John MooreTreasurer.Tho H CampbellAuditor, P. A.[Public Accounts]
paragraphs: Pay Warrant for David Davis, 3 September 18531
Treasurer of the State of Illinois,
Pay toA. Lincolnor order, the sum ofTwo Hundred & Fifty—/—Dollars, it being forD Davissalary Judge8thcircuitQuarter Ending august 31, 1853
COUNTERSIGNED AND REGISTERED:John MooreTreasurer.Tho H CampbellAuditor, P. A.[Public Accounts]
citations: The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 3 September 1853,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1853-09-03; 7 September 1853,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1853-09-07.

footnotes.text:
1An unknown person filled in the blanks of this partially printed document. John Moore
                  and Thomas H. Campbell signed the document.

2Abraham Lincoln collected this warrant in person at the state auditor’s office in
                  Springfield on September 3, 1853, presumably intending  to deliver it to David Davis
                  while  he was attending the autumn courts. Lincoln left to ride theEighth Judicial Circuitby September 7, 1853.The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 3 September 1853,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1853-09-03; 7 September 1853,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1853-09-07.
